lines.content: Shin is a simple, interactive chatbot that helps users manage their tasks efficiently.
This project was developed as part of the CS2103T Individual Project.
- **Task Management**: Add, mark, and delete tasks (ToDo, Deadline, Event).
- **Persistence**: Tasks are stored and reloaded on startup.
- **Error Handling**: Gracefully handles invalid commands and missing files.
deadline <task> /by yyyy-MM-dd - Adds a Deadline task.
event <task> /from yyyy-MM-dd /to yyyy-MM-dd - Adds an Event task.
Some portions of this project were improved with AI assistance to enhance code quality and productivity:
Error Handling Improvements (Storage.java): AI suggested better exception handling and missing file creation methods.
Refactoring of Date Formatting (Deadline.java, Event.java): AI recommended more efficient date parsing methods.
JUnit Test Cases (DeadlineTest.java, TaskListTest.java): AI-assisted in generating additional test cases for edge cases.
All AI-assisted code was reviewed, modified, and adapted to ensure correctness and compliance with the course policy.
This project was developed as part of the CS2103T course at NUS. Special thanks to:
The CS2103T teaching team for guidance.
Online Java resources such as StackOverflow for debugging inspiration.
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
attributes 'Main-Class': 'shin.Launcher' // Update with your entry point
Shin is an interactive chatbot that helps users efficiently manage tasks.
Developed as part of the CS2103T Individual Project at the **National University of Singapore (NUS), CS2103T**.
- Add, mark, unmark, and delete tasks (ToDo, Deadline, Event).
- JavaFX-based interactive UI for an intuitive experience.
- Tasks are saved automatically and reloaded on startup.
- Gracefully manages invalid commands and missing files.
- Enhancements in efficiency, exception handling, and test coverage.
Ensure you have the following installed:
Or run the JAR file directly:
What it does: Adds a simple ToDo task to your task list.
What it does: Adds a task that must be done before a specific date.
What it does: Adds a task that spans a specific start and end date.
What it does: Displays all tasks in your list, showing their status (done/not done) and type (ToDo, Deadline, or Event).
Marks the specified task as done.
What it does: Marks the specified task as not done.
What it does: Removes the specified task from your list.
What it does: Exits the chatbot.
What it does: Shows usage instructions and a summary of all available commands.
Use one command at a time.
Make sure dates follow the YYYY-MM-DD format.
Task numbers refer to their position in the displayed list.
If you see formatting issues, try spacing out your parameters carefully.
### 1Ô∏è‚É£ **Why are my tasks not saved after closing the chatbot?**
üìå The chatbot automatically saves tasks, but ensure you have write permissions in the directory.
### 2Ô∏è‚É£ **Can I enter multiple commands at once?**
üö´ No, Shin processes one command at a time.
### 3Ô∏è‚É£ **What happens if I enter an incorrect command?**
üìå Shin provides an error message along with guidance on the correct format.
- **`Shin`** - Main chatbot logic and command handling.
- **`Task, Todo, Deadline, Event`** - Different task types.
- **`Storage`** - Handles saving and loading tasks from disk.
Some parts of this project were improved using AI to enhance code quality and maintainability:
- Improved exception handling and automated file creation.
- Additional test cases for edge cases.
‚úÖ **All AI-assisted code was reviewed and refined to comply with course policies.**
This project was developed as part of the **CS2103T Software Engineering module at NUS**.
- The **CS2103T teaching team** for their guidance.
- Online resources like **StackOverflow** for debugging inspiration.
- The **SE-EDU GitHub repository** for reference materials.
This project is open-sourced under the **MIT License**.

assertEquals(LocalDate.parse("2024-02-10"), deadline.getBy()); // ‚úÖ Tests if date is stored correctly
assertEquals("[D][ ] Submit report (by: Feb 10 2024)", deadline.toString()); // ‚úÖ Ensures correct formatting
assertEquals("[D][X] Finish project (by: May 1 2024)", deadline.toString()); // ‚úÖ Check task marked as done
// AI-assisted: Suggested adding test case for invalid date format@Test

assertEquals("Invalid date format! Use yyyy-MM-dd.", exception.getMessage()); // ‚úÖ Ensures exception is thrown for wrong format

Todo todo = new Todo("Read a book");
assertEquals("Read a book", todo.getDescription()); // ‚úÖ Checks if description is stored correctly
assertFalse(todo.isDone()); // ‚úÖ Ensures default task is not done
assertTrue(todo.isDone()); // ‚úÖ Ensures marking as done works
assertEquals("[T][ ] Go jogging", todo.toString()); // ‚úÖ Ensures correct formatting
assertEquals("[T][X] Cook dinner", todo.toString()); // ‚úÖ Ensures formatting reflects completion
